cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast today, then turning northeast and accelerating Monday-Tuesday while skirting the North Carolina Outer Banks before curving east‐northeast and away from the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina (not an inland landfall but closest coastal encounter)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Florida through North Carolina, with swells extending northward to New Jersey and Delaware coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 25–35 mph possible Monday night into Tuesday; chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts (<10%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Delaware River; only minor tidal departures along nearby New Jersey/Delaware beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers and a few periods of heavy rain Monday night–Tuesday with accumulations generally 1 inch or less
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby New Jersey and Delaware beaches; minor coastal flooding at high tide
